intro: Exacum socotranum, commonly known as Socotra starflower, is a flowering plant native to the island of Socotra. It belongs to the family Primulaceae and is characterized by its star-shaped flowers that bloom in shades of white, yellow, and pink. The plant typically grows in rocky, arid environments and has adapted to the unique climate of its native habitat. Its leaves are narrow and succulent, helping it retain moisture in its dry environment. The species is notable for its ornamental value and is sometimes cultivated in gardens for its striking floral display.
